commit.message:
Support exception aliases properly in B014 (#129)

* Add tests

* Support exception aliases properly

A good example is OSError. Since Python 3.3, IOError, EnvironmentError,
select.error, etc merged into OSError and became aliases. Before this
change, both the aliases and the primary exceptions were removed from
the message.

* Functionalize

verification.payload:
tree 3047f8b5b154aac3be4d0de404b8b67253dd9f3a
parent c18db4fa8bdc15f0194541055dd4cf46dbaf18f1
author Richard Si <63936253+ichard26@users.noreply.github.com> 1593494697 -0400
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1593494697 -0700

Support exception aliases properly in B014 (#129)

* Add tests

* Support exception aliases properly

A good example is OSError. Since Python 3.3, IOError, EnvironmentError,
select.error, etc merged into OSError and became aliases. Before this
change, both the aliases and the primary exceptions were removed from
the message.

* Functionalize

commit.message:
Add Development instructions + dev extra requires (#127)

* Add Development instructions + dev extra requires

- Instruct people how to run our tests
- Add .coveragerc to only show coverage for bugbear.py
- Update setup.py to have a dev extras require to make development installing easier
- Update CI to use new dev extras install

Test:
- Follow my own documentation:
```
cooper-mbp1:flake8-bugbear cooper$ /tmp/tbb/bin/coverage run tests/test_bugbear.py
.......................
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 23 tests in 5.593s

OK
```

* Update DEVELOPMENT.md

Fix my spelling of the project itself.

Co-authored-by: Ryan Delaney <1139517+rpdelaney@users.noreply.github.com>

commit.message: Move to Version 20.1.3 + Update CHANGES in README.rst

Silence B009/B010 for non-identifiers (#116)

If an object implements __getattr__ and/or __setattr__, the second
parameter to getattr() or setattr() may not be a valid Python
identifier (e.g. getattr(foo, "123abc"). In this case bugbear should
not emit B009/B010, since changing to "foo.123abc" would be a
SyntaxError. Update the B009/B010 detection to check using a regex.

verification.payload:
tree ffe8ddba4c8c5c0a51a28d4fe9f447af2ec8176f
parent 76ee744390aac945f7c40e9c58424e67534b8523
author Peter Kolbus <peter.kolbus@gmail.com> 1580266996 -0600
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1580266996 +1100

Silence B009/B010 for non-identifiers (#116)

If an object implements __getattr__ and/or __setattr__, the second
parameter to getattr() or setattr() may not be a valid Python
identifier (e.g. getattr(foo, "123abc"). In this case bugbear should
not emit B009/B010, since changing to "foo.123abc" would be a
SyntaxError. Update the B009/B010 detection to check using a regex.

commit.message: Move to Version 20.1.2 + Update CHANGES in README.rst

Fix error on attributes-of-attributes in `except (...):` clauses (#109)

* Fix #108, error on nested Attributes
  * Add fuzz-tests to check for crashes
  * Require attrs>=19.2.0 (this is only for hypothesmith - so could be moved to .travis.yml)
Move to Version 20.1.1 + Update CHANGES in README.rst
Add new checks for except (...): clauses (#105)
B012 Fix false positive with continue/break in loops in finally (#107)

Uncomment some test asserts + Fix (#104)

- Add E998 to be ignored in flake8 config
- Sync setup.cfg with flake8 config
- Have CI to do an editable install so coverage hits the bugbear.py in cwd

commit.message:
Remove any mention of Python 2 in README (#102)

- It's 2020

Fixes #86

Warn about continue/return/break in finally block (#100)

* Refactor check_for_b901 to use a recursive loop instead of list append.

A loop is more resource effective than adding and removing elements from lists.

* B012: report warning when using return, continue or break inside finally blocks

Add explanation for not including lints in main lint tools (#93)

- Explain lints are opinionated and not standards
- Explain flake8 plugin design as the other reason
